scenarioDescription:
The HD 87646 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 87646 is a star with 1.12 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.55 times its radius. It is located 240.00 light years away from the solar system.

HD 87646 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 87646 system


HD 87646 b

HD 87646 b was discovered by the Apache Point Observatory observatory, in 2016-11, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.12 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 87646 b is 3943.200 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 87646 b is 12.400 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 87646 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 87646, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Apache Point Observatory.
name: HD 87646 - System With 1 Exoplanet
